newsitem.title: INDIA: India castor prices steady on dull overseas demand.
newsitem.headline: India castor prices steady on dull overseas demand.

text.p: Indian castorseed September delivery prices on Tuesday gained marginally by 2/3 rupees at 1,141/1,142 rupees per quintal on fresh speculative buying at lower levels, dealers said.
"Technically market is oversold and short covering has helped prices to bounce back but overall volume remained at a low ebb," a dealer said.
Fresh overseas buying remained sluggish but sentiment turned firm on reports of sliding arrivals at producing centres.
The daily average arrivals of castorseed in the Gujarat region fell to 20,000/22,000 bags (75 kg each) against the earlier average of 25,000/30,000 bags.
"Groundnut oil moved up by 2/3 rupees at 361/362 rupees per 10 kg amid lower than expected summer crop arrivals following unseasonal rains in the producing centres," one miller said.

Imported palm oil slid by a rupee at 275/276 rupees per 10 kg on fresh offerings by the reporters following reports of weak trend in the world market. In Rajkot spot groundnut oil remained quiet at 560 rupees per 15 kg.
